Anyone who delivers flowers receives Favor Points equal to what is currently shown on the Favor Point track above the Ship.

Game End: The game ends after the sixth Ship has sailed. In additional to the Favor Points earned during the game, each player receives an additional 1 Favor Point for every 3 flowers of each type they have in their possession. Gold is not worth any Favor Points. Whoever has collected the most Favor Points is the winner.

This game is an express version inspired by Santiago de Cuba by Michael Rieneck.

156413.description:
This expansion was created for the Kickstarter campaign of the book "Board Games That Tell Stories". The expansion contains 9 special Beach cards.

This thematic mini-expansion allows for taking a special Gathering action on the Beach type tile (tile no.8). Instead of gathering wood or food from the tile players can draw and resolve 1 Beach Card. This way the castaways may find precious things among the remains of the ship.
156413.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Beach Card Mini Expansion
boardgamefamily: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

156414.name: Protocol 34
156414.description:
The game is a turn based strategy game with economical macro game phase which includes:
- Politics
- Trade
- Tech development
- Building

and Micro game phase with tactical squad based combat which includes:
- Different soldier classes with skills trees
- Custom vehicle & troops loadout
- Deep damage system for vehicles and troops
- Meaningful troops moral and mental statuses
- Weather conditions which influence on stats of vehicles and troops
- Variety of mission types (Vip protection, convoy raids, hostage rescue, search and destroy etc .)
- Permadeath of soldiers

So here is a few words about game setting it's about post world war three, not very distant future with alternative history. World isn't in ruins (it's not a full post apocalypse but pretty messed up) but in a very bad state. Some terytories are in better shape, a rich ones of course live in a good cities with clean air water and ecologically clean food, poor people aren't so lucky they have to deal with desease, poor salaries raiders etc. Political map changed dramaticly some contries disappeared a new one emerged. The name of the game has a relation to the actual document of WWII between Germany and USSR the original text in ussr was kept in the special folder under number 34. The realtion is spiritual of course, it can give the mood of the uncertanty there is peace for now but for how long and at the same time war is continuing but on the different fronts in trade in politics and in actual "undercarpet" secret combat by mercenary pmc.

A few words about gameplay:

Players control a group of mercenaries,who is trying to survive in the world.After choosing a spawn region players start roam the world map in turn base manner, trading, finding themselves in different random events,building their base and of course taking missions . Countries autonomously act with each other,influencing the market and political situation(some political events can create a job oportunity with bigger challenge and at the same time with bigger profits and reputation points). As for missions-There are many types of them they are played on a smaller maps with terrain also in the turn based manner(One of the things that we want to make is a very tactical game play where diceroll isn't a decisive thing but human skill is). All in all the game has more of rouge like feel than a classical wargame with particular objectives. The process is the main fun part,but global goals also here(Player can get a citizenship of particular country and lead it to world domination,take hold of the entire PMC market and be the one who pull the strings,also there are some endings that are closely lore related).Also battle system can be used just for skirmishes.

156415.description:
(#@*^, it's fun!)

The official game of OverMen everywhere; "Bob"ball! offers the perfect combination of awesome and balls in a revolutionary, mind-altering format. This instant classic is a re-imagining of the longer-to-brew hit game you've heard only whispers about from another tier of consciousness.

"Bob"ball! is a game for two players. Try to save your mutant family and get them to the Pleasure Saucers before X-Day. Beware, there's only enough room for one more family. The other will be condemned to fry on Earth with the rest of the Normals.

So pull the wool over your own eyes, grab some dice, and praise "Bob" or kill him. You've never seen balls like these.

Use your "Bob"balls to bounce around along the grid to pick up family members and deliver them to the Pleasure Saucers. Each turn, roll three dice, assign the values to each "Bob"ball, and move. Make them hit your opponent's ball and transfer movement power to form chain reactions to keep them from scoring. Hitting another "Bob"ball stops yours and can transfer a family from one to another.
156415.name: "Bob"ball!

156416.description:
After finding their way through several encounters with hostile Dunlending warbands, a handful of Middle-earth’s greatest heroes finally arrive at the ancient, ruined city of Tharbad. There, they hope to locate the Dwarf named Nalir, who holds information that the White Wizard believes may prove valuable in the fight against the Dark Lord of Mordor. Finding the Dwarf proves to be a matter of very little difficult, but gaining the information he can provide proves to be a greater challenge...

In Trouble in Tharbad, the third Adventure Pack in "The Ring-maker" cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, your heroes must help Nalir extricate himself from the unfortunate predicament into which he has placed himself. You must battle Orcs, slip through abandoned streets, and seek to elude the spies from Mordor who have also taken an interest in the Dwarf and his information. Throughout the scenario's course of events, you must remain vigilant in order to keep Nalir alive. Should he perish, so will your chances of returning his information to Saruman, and the White Wizard's efforts to counter the threat of Mordor will be diminished.

Along with its new scenario, Trouble in Tharbad introduces a new Silvan hero, along with three copies of each new player card. You'll find more support for the Silvan and Gondor traits, the Doomed X keyword, decks that keep their threat levels at twenty or below, and more!
156416.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Trouble in Tharbad
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

156417.description:
These Custom Metal Lira Coins, intended for use with Viticulture, were offered as an add-on in the Kickstarter campaign for Tuscany: Expand the World of Viticulture, and as part of the Complete Collector's Edition. They were also offered as an add-on to the "Treasure Chest: Realistic Resource Tokens for Board Games" Kickstarter in 2014. They were also made available separately after the campaign.

72 coins in three sizes and colors:

36× ₤1 (22mm, reddish)
24× ₤2 (26mm, greyish)
12× ₤5 (32mm, yellowish)
boardgameaccessory: Tuscany: Expand the World of Viticulture
156417.name: Viticulture: Custom Metal Lira Coins

156418.name: Shuffle Dice
156418.description: Shuffle Dice plays like shuffleboard, with players trying to push objects to the end of the game board — without going over! — to land on the highest scoring regions. In this game, however, players roll dice instead of pushing discs, and the numbers rolled on the dice can multiply your score.

156420.name: Geek Out! Pop Culture Party
156420.description:
Geek Out! Pop Culture Party is a party game that can determine once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite pop culture subjects!

In this game, which is aimed at a more mainstream audience than parent game Geek Out!, you draw cards asking you to list a certain number of things which fall under a certain category: television, movies, music, literature, and more. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!) by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to "out-geek" their friends. Collect a predetermined number of cards, and you win!

156423.name: 1542 N.P.C. Names
156423.description:
from the back cover

When the players ask "What's his name?" You no longer need to fear a lack of inspiration! This product provides you with 1542 names in a handy package.

When that moment happens, open this booklet at a random page and pick a first name, then open a second random page and select their family name. To avoid repeating a name, simply cross out the names as you choose them.

This product is designed to print out as a PocketMod (8 pages on 1 sheet that folds into tiny booklet).

156424.name: March 2014: Sandstorm
156424.description:
From Introduction:

Alhameed ran as fast as he could, clawing for leverage up a large sand bank as the manipulative material forced him back down for every foot he gained. He had managed to escape the riots outside of Cairo, it was worse than any political riot he had even seen. It started out that way, another demonstration out in the square. When the screams started, he thought it was just the riot police firing more of the gas canisters they had bombarded them with earlier. Then people started to eat each other.

Now miles out of the city, his camel had been taken down by ‘something’ that had leapt up from the sand, and now there was several men with rifles and carbines looking for him… for God Knows What.

As his feet finally got traction on something harder than loose sand. He flung his back against a hard column. He could hear the yells of the men below pointing out his trail going up the slope.

When Alhameed turned around to noticed the huge gaping hole of the unearthed tomb before him. He froze in indecision. There was excavational materials strewn around, and tape blocking entrance has snapped and was now flapping in the breeze. Was that also smears of blood along the inside wall of the entrance? He had to decide, was his superstition stronger than his desire to be shot?

156425.name: My Shops
156425.description:
User Summary

My Shops is a web browser game where the player builds and runs shops. More shops become available as a player levels-up through the game. Items that a customer wishes to purchase have to be obtained from a supplier and the quicker a customer is served, the happier they are. If a customer is 'delighted' then further customers are unlocked. The quality of goods can be improved using a factory and this can increase a player's revenue.

156426.name: Tanto Cuore
156426.description:
" Designed by Masayuki Kudou and brought to you by Playdek, Tanto Cuore features classic anime art and easy-to-play mechanics. Players hire maids to staff their mansion with the goal of becoming King of Maids by acquiring the most Victory Points. Private Maids remain in play and use their special powers each turn. Some give players a bonus or affect opponents in a negative way. Opponents can make maids sick or give them bad habits, decreasing Victory Points. The player who has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins.

Using the popular "deck building" mechanic, players improve their deck of cards through play, building strategies in a straightforward manner, and using their cards to score points. Tanto Cuore by Playdek features beautiful graphics and an easy-to-play interface!

Tanto Cuore features:

Options for 2-4 players
AI opponents
Pass-and-play multiplayer gameplay (2-4 players)
Asynchronous or real-time online play (2-4 players)
Universal game application - buy once and play on all your devices
Ability to invite Playdek friends to matches
Selectable online game clocks
"Next game" button takes you to your next asynchronous online game
A game tutorial
Rule Book and Card Gallery to review game text and effects
Options for Music and SFX, animation speed
Retina support
iPhone / iPod 5 screen support
Localizationed in English and Japanese"

Source: The Developer Website.

156427.name: Sorcerous Futures
156427.description:
"You are sorcerous investors, speculating on the fates of various people and places. You might risk your sorcerous gravitas on the Forest and the Huntress, only to lose it all when a bad moon rises in the end. Or you might get a bargain on a Sailor and a Journey, striking it rich when your ship comes in on a favourable wave."

An arcane commodity speculation game of bidding and bluffing, where players attempt to purchase the most valuable cards with limited information about what their true worth will be. This information takes the form of cards dealt at the beginning, known only to their owner.

The game is played in turns, with each turn an auction. The active player chooses one card to put up for bidding, and the highest bidder pays the bank and takes the card. At the end of the game, the hidden cards are revealed and determine the worth of each purchased card, which the bank pays out. The richest player after a predetermined number of rounds is the winner.

156428.description:
Players are scholars and scribes poring over (studying, scribbling, erasing, more scribbling) an ancient manuscript. By playing cards to the free-form play area and then placing cubes on them to record their contributions, they hope to have their work be recognized by the Queen at story time.

Scoring is similar to Acquire, where the person with the most cubes scores the normal value of a card, and the second-most gets half that value. This scoring is triggered when someone plays a card with a low enough rank -- the more workers on a card, the more likely it'll get scored by a particular play.

The number of workers you place each turn is based on the number of matching suits touched by the card you play. This leads to natural clusters of suits, shaped implicitly by the opinionated nature of the deck.

When the deck runs out, or a player runs out of workers, or a player reaches 100 points, the game ends with a final scoring round. The player with the most points is the winner.
156428.name: The Young Queen's Palimpsest

156429.name: Pirates: Tides of Fortune
156429.description:
Set sail for riches and plunder as you battle your way from half-drowned prisoner to legendary scourge of the Seven Seas! Form your crew from the most ruthless buccaneers to stumble the streets of Tortuga, then build a pirate fleet to bring whole colonies to kneel beneath your flag!

You’ll master game-changing Discoveries, Trade, and Diplomacy as you raise your Pirate Haven from a nameless desert island to the bustling hub of your seaborne Empire. Invite your shipmates along for a full share of the spoils as you sail the uncharted reaches of the Caribbean - use cunning, deceit, and the cutlass to make it all yours!

Mysterious Pirate Queens await your hand, your stalwart crew await your orders, and untold fame and treasure await your pleasure - if ye be bold enough to sail the Tides of Fortune.

What say you?

Source: The Publisher Website.

156430.name: Agents Secrets
156430.description:
At the height of the cold war, KGB and CIA fight for controlling the world: In Berlin, Cairo, Rio, or Hong Kong, accomplish your missions, counter opposing agents and be wary of double agents...unless you are one yourself!

Agents Secrets is a party game for 6 to 12 players who play in opposing (CIA vs. KGB) to win missions all over the world. (The game is freely inspired by "Module 6", a non-credited Russian game, recently discovered.) Each team member receives a secret identity (agent or double agent).

During each turn mission cards of various value are revealed, then each player receives secretly three action cards. The turn is resolved after two rounds. During each round, the players of each team can freely discuss their strategy, then secretly assign an action to a mission. Actions are revealed simultaneously. After the second round, all actions are resolved and each mission card is won by the team with the best cards combination.

After six turns, the team with the most points wins.

156431.name: Nephilim: Le Jeu de Rôle de L'Occulte Contemporain
156431.description:
publisher blurb

Nephilim, Le Jeu de Rôle de l’occulte contemporain, vous permet d’interpréter des êtres élémentaires incarnés depuis la chute de l’Atlantide dans des corps humains.

Cette édition toute en couleur célèbre le 20e Anniversaire de ce grand classique et comprend le livret d’Hénoch ainsi que les cinq codex élémentaires.

- Le livre d'Hénoch, le livret d'introduction aux Nephilim, contient la création du personnage et détaille le moteur de jeu.

- Les 5 codex élémentaires décrivent les Nephilim par élément, les Sciences occultes, les points de règles influencés par cet élément et les secrets liés à l'élément.


Nephilim, the roleplaying game of contemporary occult, allows you to interpret human beings basic ingrown since the fall of Atlantis in human bodies.

This edit colour celebrates the 20th anniversary of this classic and includes the book of Enoch and the five basic codex.

-The book of Enoch, the introduction to the Nephilim booklet, contains the creation of the character and details the game engine.

-The 5 Basic codices describe the Nephilim by element, the occult, the points of rules influenced by this element and secrets related to the element.

156433.name: Labyrinth Lord Reference Sheets
156433.description:
from the designer's blog:
...some reference sheets with the tables from the rulebooks compiled into one place. After fiddling with them some more today, I decided to offer them up for other people to use. So far, I've compiled all of the ability score tables into a master table and arranged the class tables, equipment tables, spell lists, and combat tables into sheets appropriate for double-sided printing. I've also included a sheet with the hirelings charts, the XP chart, the monster reaction table, and the chance of getting lost in the wilderness.

... including the treasure tables, including the tables for randomly stocking a dungeon...

All of these tables are from the main LL rulebook...

156434.name: Suzuki TT Superbikes: Real Road Racing Championship
156434.description:
From the back of the North American PS2 case:

The Most Dangerous Road-Race Ever!

Real Bikes: 125 GP, 250 GP, Super Sport, Super Stock, Sidecar

Real Tracks: Isle of Man TT, Northwest 200, Southern 100, Ulster GP, Macau GP, Aberdare Prix, Oliver's Prix

Welcome to the most exciting, white knuckle racing experience! Bringing together seven of the most challenging road racing circuits from around the world, each physically punishing and technically demanding in their own right. From 125 GP up to the Superbike class this is an unforgiving test of speed, nerve, and skill, and is exhilarating to the extreme.

So choose your circuit, choose your bike, get read, let's race!!

156435.name: The Time Lord Companion Express Edition (Third Edition)
156435.description:
from the introduction:
This, the third edition of this booklet, was designed as a set of rules to allow published adventures from FASA Corporation's Doctor Who Role Playing Game to be used in the Time Lord environment. To do this, the GM controlled characters and pre-generated Player Characters (PC's for short) need to be converted over to the Time Lord game system. This booklet provides the rules, tables, and guidelines to do this. Included in the booklet are statistics for the Eighth Doctor, presented in May 1996 in a made-for-TV movie shown simultaneously in the United States and the United Kingdom.

The third edition streamlines the rules and corrects the vast majority of errors in the Second Edition. This edition replaces all previous editions. For sake of brevity, the character creation rules created by Ian Marsh and Allen Shock do not appear in this document. They are available on the Internet at the website address at the end of this document. The first edition of this document originally had their rules included with these, but were removed when the Second Edition was published.

156436.name: River King: A Wonderful Journey
156436.description:
From the back of the English/European PS2 case:

In Water Drop village, a place teeming with nature, live a family of four.

One day during summer vacation, I set out on a journey. A journey to find the legendary River King, wherever it man be... And... so did my little sister! And Dad! Even Mom set out on a journey, too!!! The personal journey of each member of that family now begins.

Dogs and sheep and other animals will block your path through the land. You can obtain bait from various locations throughout the map, os be sure to use Search whenever you spot a suspicious-looking location.

You can cook and eat the fish you catch. In order to cook, you need cooking recipes.

You can sell the fish you catch to the fish shop and earn money. Once we've saved up some money, let's go shopping for fishing tackle and items.

Once you have your tackle, head for your fishing point. Master live bait fishing, lure fishing, and fly fishing, and fish up a variety of fish.

156437.name: Patrol:  WWII
156437.description:
Patrol: WWII is a fast playing man-to-man skirmish system that recreates squad patrols in any theatre of the Second World War with as little as ten miniatures per side and a 4'x4' play area. Individual games last from 15 minutes to 1 hour allowing for multiple exciting games in an evening's play.

Patrol takes you beyond line ‘em up and shoot ‘em down miniature gaming. Opposing squads draw one of the 20 missions offering a large variety of tactical challenges that reflect historical tactics and weapon effects.

Stats and weapons for American, Commonwealth, Soviet, German, Italian, Japanese, and Partisans forces are included. Additional appendix expands the game into the Korean War with new weapons and missions.

Monstrous tanks, zooming jeeps with 30 cal blazing, flame throwers and mortars raining death, along with random battlefield events, create a chaotic and dangerous battlefield where a realistic morale system recreates the reactions of soldiers and their squad leader's attempts to motivate them.

A complete campaign lets you keep the same squad over multiple games (if you can keep them alive). Survivors gain experience and skills, scrounge for weapons and gear, and try to get some sleep before drawing replacements and ammunition for the next patrol.

156439.name: Block Legend
156439.description:
User Summary

Block Legend is a game that mixes RPG and Puzzle elements. As in a typical Fantasy RPG, you're fighting random monsters, buying items and levelling up.

But exploration and combat are resolved exclusively through a game mechanism derived from the Collapse series: the player is presented with a grid and has to tap on groups of two or more blocks of the same color to remove them from the grid. The type/color of the removed block determine what happens: inflincting damage on enemy, healing, collecting gold...

156440.name: In Cerca di Fortuna (2nd Edition)
156440.description:
designer summary

Second edition, with same game mechanics and mainly the same structure but with a revised text. Number of paragraphs is slightly increased because of minor enhancement in some links between them.

156441.description:
The standalone expansion to Hero Brigade, the fast-paced heroic card game for 1-2 players that features elements of deck-building and positional card-battling. Take on the role of the Heroes or the Villains and prepare to throw down! Hero Brigade 2 introduces new Heroes and Villains and new rules for 3 and 4-player tag team battles in combination with the original game.

Each character card can be played in three different ways (deployed to your Party's Front Row, deployed to your Support Row, or used for a one-time game effect). Hero Brigade also offers unique twists on conventional deck-building mechanisms. Drawing extra cards and eliminating your starting cards can hurt you in the long term as you permanently lose cards from your deck each time you reshuffle and each time one of your characters is defeated. Running out of cards loses you the game!
156441.name: Hero Brigade: Hero Harder

156442.description:
Asking for Trobils is a worker-placement boardgame where the player is trying their best to rid the star system of Trobils (space pests). You play a Trobil Hunter - flinging the space vermin into the star, and dealing with unsavory folk just to get the job done.

Players start with one ship, placing it at various locations to gather resources that will allow you to trap Trobils. But just one ship may not be enough, so you can fly through a wormhole to create two or even three ships to help you gather resources.

You can make connections to gain more resources or hang around the local Riffraff. Send pirates, bounty hunters, or gangsters out to make areas rougher for your opponents, or enhance locations for everyone by sending out traders and courtesans.

For every Trobil card you capture, you gain victory points. The player with the most points at the end wins
156442.name: Asking for Trobils

156443.description: Paranormal investigation co-operative board game. Discover the truth of each case. Play in the dark, only with the character´s flashlights. In AVGhost we have to choose one of the 4 different ends for each case by color code. Each case has 5 pieces of evidences, 3 EVP´s and 1 video. We have to use the QR code reader from our smartphone or tablet to ear EVP´s and finally watch the video to discover the truth of the case. All of these, listen the soundtrack specially composed for the game, and fighting with all of the ghosts that living in the places we are going to visit. 40 ghost miniatures and 4 characters with real LED flashlights and the environmental rules, will make us feel the fear!
156443.name: AVGhost

156444.name: The Nightmare Kingdom
156444.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,

The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. Out there somewhere is a place for every dream... and every nightmare.

The Nightmare Kingdom is a realm of pure fear, capable of warping its highly mutable fabric to take the shape of anyone's darkest dreams - or spinning newly crafted horrors as of yet unimaginable. In that sadistic playground beyond compare, the gruesome Ghoul toys with its hapless victims, feeding upon their fright as they stumble through the sinister scenery pursued by the realm's monstrous boogeymen. Ancient, primal, and terrifyingly powerful, the Nightmare Kingdom bends the rules of gossamer reality to the breaking point, twisting so hard you'll scream.'

156445.name: Addendum: Blessings & Curses
156445.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Blessing ignored becomes a Curse.

A magical enhancement to Lords of Gossamer & Shadow, allowing characters to place beneficial or harmful magical effects upon persons, places, or even things. Allowing PCs and GMs to emulate some of the greatest stories, be it brother cursing brother before being thrown in a pit of despair, or a fey lady blessing the ruler of a land.

This addendum provides magicians with the means of crafting blessings and/or curses, including ways they interact with Stuff and with other powers. A step-by-step system walks magicians through the process of describing the condition to be bestowed, its qualities (severity, persistence, duration, etc.), and the means it may be cast. Also provided are three sample usages of the power: mild, moderate, and major.

Addendum: Blessings & Curses can be used in any game based on Erick Wujcik's Diceless Role-Playing, existing alongside powers such as Sorcery and utilizing a system identical to Artifacts & Creatures. Allowing you to seamlessly enhance your new or existing game with a wondrous new discovery.

156446.description:
Dicey Curves Deluxe Edition, available from TheGameCrafter.com, includes the base game (with new track cards) plus the DANGER! Expansion (with new on-track obstacle bits).

From the back of the box:
Dicey Curves is a party-style car racing game that is fun for the whole family! The track is built during the game from a deck of track cards, giving a different race every time. Roll dice and form combos to move your cars down the track, and use control chips to make adjustments when the dice aren't cooperating. Start your engines and get ready to roll!

Includes DANGER! Expansion. The DANGER! Expansion amps up the party game into a dash of take-that, dangers and damage.
156446.name: Dicey Curves: Deluxe Edition

156447.name: Adventure Quarterly (Issue 4 - Jun 2013)
156447.description:
From publisher blurb:

What the ….?

There's often those moments in an adventure when you either look at what's going on, or back at what's happened, and shout out "What the...?"

Within this installment of Adventure Quarterly there are several such moments awaiting your discovery.

Ruins Perilous, Level 2, The Warren: Life in the Warren is in a state of upheaval. The story unfolding among this pack of once noble ratfolk is one of deceit and uncertainty, as lust for power conflicts with a struggle for dignity. This 2nd level adventure by T.H. Gulliver with additional design by Jonathan McAnulty, enjoy the heights of Shakespearian tragedy that will test the mettle of your adventurers. (Level 1 can be found in Adventure Quarterly #2)

Legend of the Huntress: an exploration adventure for 4th-5th level characters by Agston Petz; it involves the secret behind a recently discovered painting and a quest for a great jewel, where the PCs must contend with a menace in the shadows of the Dire Weald.

Self-Determination: a mystery/location adventure for 15th level PCs in which that is the perfect start up after a total party kill, They wake up bereft of all their gear in an unknown realm, and must determine what has happened to them and why.

Additionally, Creighton Broadhurst offers further dungeon miscellany and our own Steven D. Russell starts a new series on wide-open sandbox campaign design. Enjoy the contents, and stay for the tormenting of your players!

156448.name: Adventure Quarterly (Issue 5 - Feb 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Wide Open Sandboxing II - Instant NPCs
156448.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adventure Quarterly Relaunch!

Welcome to the latest issue of Adventure Quarterly, now with new hand drawn cartography by Tommi Salama and all original art to help create encounters and stories you want to be a part of. Where creative designers cut their teeth, or continue to sink seasoned canines, into the meat of what makes an enjoyable adventure.

Ruins Perilous, Level 3, The Sensodrome: Immerse yourself in the Sensodrome. At one time this magnificent subterranean concert hall that has been transformed in to puzzle traps for all your senses A location adventure for 3rd level PCs that tests the mettle of adventurers by Mike Welham.

Legacy of the Fishermage: A unique new quest adventure for 9th level characters from Michael Allen, The Salmon of Wisdom who ate the acorns that fell from the Tree of Knowledge has spawned again and the ogre, Grenneck Shieldfist, is close to finding it and succeeding where the Fishermage who long sought for it, failed.

Paradox: this gauntlet of combat and temporal conjecture, throws the PC into the midst of a disintegrating multiverse, can the PCs set things right or will all they have adventured for be for nothing? A great capstone adventure for long running campaigns and 18th level characters by Bret Boyd

156449.name: x6 Core Rules (2nd edition)
156449.description:
x6 is a universal system for pen-and-paper roleplaying games. This core edition presents the basic game mechanics comprising the x6 system, along with a basic selection of character abilities and equipment that would suit a contemporary game setting. With some work, the information presented here can be adapted to suit a science fiction, fantasy, horror or almost any other roleplaying genre.

This 2nd edition is an amalgamation of x6 and another generic system, Multi10. The core resolution mechanics of the first edition have been retained and enhanced, while most of the character building and combat systems have been imported from Multi10. The result should be a capable game system with a decent amount of character customisation and fast combat.

156450.name: The Dread Shard
156450.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our heroes visit a great festival only to discover that it’s a trap devised to trigger a powerful demonic ritual. The feast soon becomes a slaughter as a Valk horde charges into the city.

156451.name: Labyrinth Lord Monster Matrix
156451.description:
from the introduction:
These pages collect the basic information about the monsters presented in the Labyrinth Lord™ core rules into an easy-to-read reference chart.

user summary:
These charts are patterned after the Monster Matrix in the old AD&D DM's Guide. Vital statistics are laid out in single row entries, without the monster description, for quick reference.

156452.name: A Domino Double Header
156452.description:
A ziplock package containing two games for solo or partication play.

"The Elephant in the Room" by Graham Evans is a cooperative game in which the players take the role of velites (Roman light infantry) trying to kill or drive off a Carthaginian war elephant, controlled by the game system, before it can contact the Roman heavy infantry.

The game lasts about 30 minutes and requires four sets of dominoes.

"Greyhounds in the Slips" by Phil Steele is inspired by Shakespeare's description of the Siege of Harfleur in "Henry V". A variant of the Society of Ancients' game Anno Domino, the aim for Henry is to get his men to storm the breach in the wall of Harfleur, while the French player must attempt to hold him off.

The game requires two sets of dominoes.

156453.description:
Someone's made fruit salad and left chopped up fruit all over the kitchen! Time to pair up the fruit halves and put things together once again.

To set up Tutti Frutti, lay out the 48 double-sided tiles on the table; each side of a tile shows half of a fruit. Each player takes one tile at random to start the game. Then as quickly as possible, everyone picks up fruit tiles one by one and adds them to the stack already in their hand — but to add a tile, you must match the fruit half showing on the top (or bottom) of your stack with an identical fruit half on the tile being added. Thus, you're combining the fruit halves to create a whole fruit.

Players can flip over tile on the table to see the reverse side. Once all the tiles have been claimed or no one wants any more, players compare their tile stacks and the players with the taller pile wins — but only if all the fruits have been combined correctly! If not, he loses and the player with the next tallest stack wins.
156453.name: Tutti Frutti
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 26 - Happy Birthday Ding & Dent!!

156454.name: Labyrinth Lord Original Edition Characters Reference Sheets
156454.description:
from the designer's blog post:
These sheets include the basic ability score, class, combat, and equipment information. I didn't include the magic items tables as those are exactly the same as in my LL reference sheets.

There are two versions of the sheets included in the document, one with shading and one with lines to highlight the tables. Feel free to print and use whichever you like better, the information is exactly the same.

boardgamecompilation: Tuscany: Expand the World of Viticulture
156455.description: The Complete Collector's Edition of Viticulture quite simply is a box with distinctive art, with two [filled] compartments in it: One for the Viticulture (2nd printing) complete box, and the other for the Tuscany complete box. Thus, the Complete Collector's Edition.
156455.name: Viticulture: Complete Collector's Edition

156456.name: Die Träume des Nophru-Ka
156456.description:
from the back of the book
In only 3 month - Jan to Mar 29 - the Characters are lead in 6 scenarios from Boston to Transsylvania, Malta and Egypt. And if that wouldn't be enough, there are distant times and worlds as well.
Die Bestie is a three-books-campaign that leads in 18 chapters until the Great Depression of 1929. Can the characters void the plans of the Brotherhood, before it is to late?
The Campaign uses material of the original Day of the Beast, but expands upon that. This book contains 2 new scenarios as well as the description of Boston, Transylvania, Malta and G'harne.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
156457.description:
Players in Gloobz need to act quickly to grab the right things from the table before anyone else can.

Seven plastic items start in the middle of play: three paint cans (blue, red, yellow), three critters (triangular, square, round) and one boss gloob that is all colors and shapes. On a turn, a player calls either "more" or "less", then flips the top card of the deck. Depending on what's called, players race to grab the items that correspond to the color and shape most (or least) visible on the card, scoring one point for each item correctly grabbed. If a magnifying glass appears on the card, players can grab anything they want. If the boss shows up, just grab him and score three points if you do.

The number of points needed to win depends on the number of players.

Attrapez-les tous !
Les Gloobz sont d’adorables créatures mais elles sèment la pagaille partout où elles passent :
rattrapez-les vite ! Selon l’annonce du tour, saisissez les figurines dont la forme et la couleur sont les moins ou les plus représentées sur la carte en jeu. Chaque bonne figurine saisie vous fait marquer 1 point mais en cas d’erreur, une pénalité vous attend. Et des cartes spéciales viennent se mêler à ce joyeux désordre. Ayez l’esprit et le geste vifs pour attraper ces drôles de créatures avant vos adversaires! Points forts : matériel ludique, réfléchir vite, ambiance survoltée.
156457.name: Gloobz
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 26 - Happy Birthday Ding & Dent!!
Episode 6 - GenCant with Suzanne Sheldon

156458.description:
In RoboRama the goal is simple: Race against the other players by constantly picking the right combination of action cards and routes for your robots in order to cross the arena. Or — if that isn't thrilling enough — add the ChaosBot, which can be controlled by everyone. Finish first with your four robots on the opposite side of the arena and you win! Of course this is easier said than done. After all, you are not the only one trying to win, making it pretty crowded in the arena.

RoboRama offers three different types of play with multiple variations; the game is easy to learn, but all the more difficult to win.
156458.name: RoboRama
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - RoboRama
The Spiel #205 - Programs! Get Your Programs!

156460.name: Flesh for Eihort
156460.description:
from the Introduction:
Flesh for Eihort is a Call of Cthulhu adventure for 3-6 experienced investigators. A chance encounter leads the investigators into a hunt for a serial killer with links to the cult of Eihort. The setting is Ramsey Campbell’s fictional Gloucestershire town of Brichester where the Great Old One has its lair. I’ve followed the common convention of expressing SAN losses as two numbers separated by a “/”. The first number is the loss following a successful SAN roll, the second number is the loss for a failed roll.

156461.name: Animal Suspect
156461.description:
Don't be afraid of looking silly because that's the only way you'll let others discover your true animal nature.

To set up Animal Suspect, lay out six animal cards and six expression cards on the game board next to the die faces numbered 1-6. On a turn, one player rolls two dice in secret, looks at the cards matching the numbers rolled, then imitates this particular combination as best she can. Will she be a shy mosquito? An attentive walrus? An amorous octopus? Whoever guesses the proper combination first wins a card, along with the imitator, and whoever collects the most cards wins.

156462.name: Live Evil
156462.description:
from the Introduction:
Live Evil is a modern day CALL OF CTHULHU Convention scenario suitable for four to six players of age 15 and above. It is partially inspired by the Cross my Heart, Hope to Die scenario in Chaosium’s recent “Goatswood and less pleasant places” supplement (although I had written half of the scenario before becoming aware of this particular supplement). The author suggests that, as with most Call of Cthulhu scenarios, a lower age limit of 15 years old for players.

from For the Keeper:
In the wilder and more desolate regions of the UK, untouched by three thousand years of “civilization”, many legacies of the elder days remain. Perhaps the most infernal and dreaded legacy is the worship of the Great Old Ones.

156463.name: The Gaean Reach
rpghonor: 2014 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
156463.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Gaean Reach is a brand new game written by Robin D Laws with Jim Webster and Peter Freeman based on the science-fiction works of Dying Earth author Jack Vance. It will use a new GUMSHOE-meets-Skulduggery system.

The Gaean Reach is a fictional setting developed across a series of loosely connected novels. It exists in the far future and can be defined as those parts of our galaxy in which human colonies have become established. The scope of the Gaean Reach varies between novels, growing large over a timeline of several millennia at least.

The richness of the settings, the vast array of cultures and races, each with their own bewildering customs and traditions ensure that this is a setting unlike any other. This is not a background where NPCs exist purely to provide clues for the next stage of the adventure, instead, the NPCs are complex individuals, with their own aims and objectives, with whom you have to interact and that interaction may send the game off in surprising directions.

156464.name: Redux: Dark Matters
156464.description:
User Summary:

Redux: Dark Matters is a remake of the game DUX. The game is a sideway scrolling shoot'em up. There is six stages in the game, and the aim is to destroy the bosses at the end of every stage. You can play the game at normal och veteran difficulty, each with different ship to control. You begin the game with three lives and can upgrade the ship during the game.

156465.name: General Background
156465.description:
from Pagan Call: General Background:
The present chapter provides general information pertinent to the Pagan Call campaign as a whole, and applicable to all scenarios. Specific information to each scenario can be found in the relevant chapter. Note that each chapter of the campaign, with minor adaptations, can be played as a stand-alone scenario; in that case the information presented in this chapter, though useful, is not essential and can be skipped.

156466.name: The Fall of Guthlac Abbey
156466.description:
from the introduction:
1020 AD, October 31: the dean of Canterburh Aethelnoth “the Good” (who will be consecrated Archbishop on November 13th), has dispatched the investigators to Guthlac abbey to ascertain the condition of brother Jens of Ythancaestir (Bradwell on Sea).

156467.name: The Clan
156467.description:
from The Introduction:
The investigators travel to the small village of Ythancaestir in Essex, 1) in pursuit of the kidnapped Brother Paulinus, and 2) to seek out the suspect family of Brother Jens of Ythancaestir (who changed into a Deep One and whose father uses the pen name “priest”). They find an old Christian church threatened by a Deep One clan and their allies. The Deep Ones have been charged by the serpent man with placing an altar stone at the head of the World Serpent ley line.

156468.name: The Blue Stone
156468.description:
from The Introduction:
The investigators travel from Essex to Northumbria in an attempt to track down Rollo One­Eye’s daughter Unn, who in turn may lead them to her master­ the mysterious “Wanderer”. On her trail, they find a pestilent village and become infected. They soon discover the secret Odin Mine where the serpent man has been excavating the Blue Stone, confront Unn, discover some of the serpent man’s plans, and hopefully an antidote for their infection.

156469.name: Helfer im Verkehr! Spiel mit Skala-Mobil
156469.description:
The goal of the game is to drive 2 cars from the starting space to the parking lot in the center of the game board, while minding the traffic rules. The speed of the cars is determined by a toy car, the skala-mobil, instead of a die. By driving the skala-mobil while pushing a lever on the left side, a scale in the roof of the car is rotated and then stopped by releasing the lever.

This game has most likely been pubished in 1936 or 1937.

156470.name: The Tower
156470.description:
from The Introduction:
Winter/spring 1021 AD: the investigators are sent by Stigand, personal chaplain of King Cnut, on a delicate mission to rescue a holy man held hostage by a demon­ worshipper named Quintus. During their secret mission to find Quintus in the Welsh wilderness, the investigators end up in a desolate region, overrun at night by a strange mist. This scenario is the campaign’s turning point, a rite of passage, and the plot is by design more linear than the others. In terms of mood and themes, it draws much on the works of Arthur Machen. We advise the keeper to read Machen’s “the Great God Pan” and “the Three Impostors”. Importantly, investigators who die in this scenario may come back in the sequel. In order to facilitate their return from Limbo, the keeper is advised to stage mysterious deaths, preferably ones that leave no body behind.

156471.name: Shadow Kingdoms
156471.description:
from The Introduction:
February 29th, 2010. In investigating a “sex ring”, the investigators – affiliated to a special police force – keep a run-down hotel under surveillance. The stakeout quickly degenerates into a bizarre crime scene.

The investigation eventually leads the investigators to London, where they uncover a global conspiracy and find out that their world is not quite what it seems. The investigators draw the attention of a secret organization and soon wind up in a nightmarish web of deceit and occult machinations.

At the center of this web lurks the influential Chinese businessman Chih.

156472.name: Annwn
156472.description:
from The Introduction:
Having fled a nightmarish future dominated by Serpent People (“Shadow Kingdoms”) or the dangers of the Nameless Mist (“The Tower”), the investigators wake knowing they must act quickly to stop a catastrophe befalling the world. The problem is, they’re not on earth, they’re in Annwn (pronounced an’oon), a deceivingly familiar dreamland bereft of humanity. The party slowly realizes something is wrong as they rush across the land, encountering evidence of hidden horrors. False hope dawns in the form of a Viking trading party, but they are just as lost as the investigators. Finally, after days of both mundane and supernatural hardships, the investigators find some answers and details of a route home...

156473.description:
Strike North. Japan vs. the Soviet Union, 1941

Strike North presumes that Imperial Japan has decided to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, instead of going to war with the United States. Conceptually, a Japanese invasion of the Soviet Union would be in conjunction with the German attack on the USSR (Operation Barbarossa) on 22 June, 1941. The strategic possibilities of this alternative course are incredible; The Soviets will be under the pressure of fighting a two-front war. However, by following this strategy, the Japanese would be temporarily abandoning their planned invasions of the resource regions of the East Indies and beyond, leaving Japan less than a half-year of oil to sustain their war effort.
The map shows Northeast Asia as it was in 1941, with each hex on the map equaling roughly 37 miles (60 kilometers) from side to opposite side. Each game turn represents one month of operations. The units are brigades, divisions and corps.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters
156473.name: Strike North Japan vs. the Soviet Union, 1941

156474.description:
MERCS: Recon - Assassination Protocol is a fully cooperative, stand-alone game set in the exciting MERCS world. Recon uses a modular setup that allows for a highly replayable experience.

Players are MERCS infiltrating an opposing MegaCon location. The MERCS team must fight through the tight corridors of the structure, capture and interrogate worker-citizen, find mission objectives, and breach and secure the package.

Recon utilizes MERCS well known dynamic, high-quality miniatures, an engaging fog-of-war mechanic with variable agent movement, escalating security forces, and a tension-filled end game through a unique breach and clear mechanic.
156474.name: MERCS: Recon – Assassination Protocol

156475.name: Quick Start Cthulhu Dark Ages
156475.description:
from the Introduction:
Interested in Chaosium's Call of Cthulhu and Cthulhu Dark Ages? You're not alone!

Call of Cthulhu is Chaosium's classic role-playing game of Lovecraftian horror in which ordinary people are confronted by the
terrifying and alien forces of the Cthulhu Mythos.

Cthulhu Dark Ages started as a supplement for Call of Cthulhu, setting the clock of Lovecraftian horror back 1000 years, right
into the Middle Ages. Cthulhu Dark Ages as a stand-alone role-playing game was published by Chaosium Inc. in 2004.

Quick Start Cthulhu Dark Ages is a direct adaptation of Quick Start Cthulhu (Quick Start Rules for the Call Of Cthulhu Role-Playing Game) written by Ben Monroe and Sandy Petersen ... Although Cthulhu Dark Ages is fully compatible with the philosophy and the game system of Call of Cthulhu, owing to particularities of the Dark Ages, some adjustments and additions to the quick start rules have been made.

All you need to play Cthulhu Dark Ages for the first time is this booklet, some dice, plenty of imagination, and your friends.

Welcome to the Worlds of Call of Cthulhu!

156476.name: Sogailraugh
156476.description:
from A Guide to Sogailraugh:
The fictitious village of Sogailraugh is located in mid- western Ireland in an area called Connacht. This village is part of a larger kingdom (tuath) called Ui Briuin Ai. Sogailraugh is home to a dozen landed families, four landless renting families, a church and the local lord’s home. Eight families have farms, the rest dwell in a small central village and are craftsmen. The largest dwelling in the central village is the home of ri tuath Diarmuid and his lady Shauna.

156477.description:
Meeples are manufactured in a variety colors, whether you need to replace a lost meeple or desire to purchase a set in a non-traditional color.

Basic meeples come in three sizes:
12 mm (Travel Carcassonne)
16 mm (Standard)
19 mm (Mega Meeple)

Entire Carcassonne sets of 14 meeples (8 Meeples, 1 MegaMeeple, 1 Builder, 1 Pig, 1 Mayor, 1 Cart, 1 Barn) are also available, albeit in limited colors.

For the exact color options available, please consult the Meeple Source website directly.
156477.name: Carcassonne: Meeples

156478.description:
This set contains:
33 wood
27 clay (bricks)
15 reed
18 stone
27 wheat
18 carrots

While the resourceeples and veggiemeeples are not available as separate sets, each individual resource can be acquired separately.
156478.name: Agricola: Resourceeples and Veggiemeeples Set (Wooden Farm Resources and Vegetables)

156479.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 51 - Mar 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Background Skill Generation
Doing It My Way: The Eaglestone Trade Index
In A Store Near You: Autonomous Space Mine
In A Store Near You: Genichi-class Personal Watercraft
Raconteurs’ Rest: Drop Out, Part Twenty Seven
Up Close and Personal: Lyons Carlton
156479.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #51: March 2014

Cover: Andrew Boulton

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

156480.description:
Paved With [my...] Intentions is a quick card-drafting, story-telling, party game. You will mix and match sentence fragments, balancing the story you want to tell about yourself against building a winning score—then read your creation aloud and hope a high score overshadows a potentially embarrassing or frightening self-portrait.

The official goal is to produce a lineup of seven cards with the (absolute) greatest value, but most of a player's effort goes into putting together a story they'll be satisfied reading aloud to the group—and in the event of a tie or someone scoring exactly zero, the best story wins (by player voting).

The story chunks on the cards contain elements of comedy, horror, working in an office, sexuality, religion, new-age mysticism, dreams, nightmares, and more, and are frequently only a sentence or a fragment of a sentence, so it's unusual for any single theme to dominate even a single player's hand. Some cards, or combinations of cards, are explicit in their depiction of sex and violence, which will either put players off the game or push them to create the wildest stories possible.
156480.name: Paved With [my...] Intentions

156481.description:
Uptown Espresso is a real-time competitive card game in which you are a barista making drinks at a café. You have a grid of up to nine card stacks in front of you that represent the bar, the fridge, and your line of customers, and you need to stock up, take orders, make drinks, and ring up customers! Everyone takes their turns at the same time, and you'll need to keep an eye out for unruly customers, stock deliveries, shift changes, and the occasional spilling of milk — all of which can foil your plans.

The first barista to earn $50 wins.
156481.name: Uptown Espresso

156482.description:
"Unknown" is a cooperative tile based exploration and resource management game set in a post-apocalyptic world. Each turn players use their action points to move their meeples, explore new tiles, gather resources, interact with environmental hazards and battle enemies in order to complete objectives.

Players must complete objectives while keeping the base supplied with food. If players fail to keep the base supplied with food before completing all objectives, the game is lost.

"Unknown" features a vast array of characters, hazards, enemies and objectives that are mixed together each game, providing a unique experience every time.
156482.name: Unknown

156483.name: Byte Saver
156483.description:
The network has been infected with a Virus, it's up to you to save the day!
Collect the Bytes and get them to the Cloud, before they become corrupted!
Control your orb by tilting the device, collected Bytes will follow wherever you go, but keep them away from Corrupted Bytes, or you'll lose them forever!!
Getting to the end is easy, but can you save them all?

Source: The Developer Website.

156484.name: Color Oil
156484.description:
In Color Oil, your task is to fill the board with the same color oil. The game starts in the cell labeled S. Tap the buttons on the bottom to change the color of oil to match the surrounding cells. Do this repeatedly until all cells are of the same color.
You should complete each level in a limited number of steps, which is displayed in the top right corner. Try to collect all three stars for each level. It is not as easy as you think!
Enjoy relaxing ambient background music while playing the game. Use headphones or earphones for the best experience.
Oil and water sound effects
Relaxing background music
Easy and Hard levels
HD Graphics
Localized for 6 languages
Unlock Atlantis!

Source: The Developer Website.

156485.name: Furiosity
156485.description:
Strip away every layer of the game, not mindlessly, but by logical thinking.
In the end, the first person to solve every level, will win something possibly amazing...

...

Furiosity was built [a] game jam, centered around the theme of making a game in a genre you hate. If you follow the mobile apps world, you will certainly have heard about 'Curiosity', the pseudo-game by Peter Molyneux where everyone is tapping blocks away from a giant cube with the purpose of clicking away the very last block, and to find out what 'life-changing amazing' thing is inside.
Some people think 'Curiosity' is a genius social experiment, others think it promotes mindless idiocy. Anyway, it made me create 'Furiosity' on a whim, or what Curiosity would have been if it was actually a game.

Source: The Game Website.

156486.name: Maximum Chase
156486.description:
The chase is on as gangsters pursue you through the streets and into the desert. In Maximum Chase, you are LA cop Rick Summer, who begins to uncover a sinister plot to destroy Los Angeles. As you move closer to the truth, you'll find yourself outrunning the police and enemies, shooting out the tires of pursuers, and taking down enemy helicopters. Thankfully, you'll have multiple weapons and vehicles to choose from. Combine driving and shooting to push through 10 levels on the traffic-snarled streets of Los Angeles.

Source: The Game Website.

156488.name: Powershot Pinball
156488.description:
From the back of the English/European PS2 case:

Powershot Pinball

All the addictive charm of the classic pinball machine brought to your living room.


A great mix of thrilling traditional tables and inspired fantasy settings.
Groundbreaking double player option: Battle it out in duel mode or choose to play cooperatively.
Multiple modes of play: Time Mode, Adventure Mode and Multiplayer.

156489.name: The Lost City of Bransik
156489.description:
from the introduction:
In The Lost city of Bransik , the PC is approached by Neekolist Rauveen to recover the spellbook of the powerful mage, Herinack Dersuni. The mage’s library/workshop was in the Lost City of Bransik which was swallowed up in an earthquake centuries ago. Offering a handsome reward, plus spoils from the recovery operation, Neekolist Rauveen wants the PC to find this lost city, descend into its ruins and find the library. The library is well protected by numerous traps and challenges, the PC must also race a rival wizard clan’s rogue to the spellbook to keep it out of the Gray Scorpion’s hands. The Lost city of Bransik is an adventure for one GM and a single PC rogue level 6-8.

156493.name: Perfect Ace: Pro Tournament Tennis
156493.description:
From the back of the English/European PS2 case:

It's the semi-final of the championships, you're facing match point against a formidable opponent ranked 42 places higher than you. You've already faulted on your first serve and you are staring defeat in the face. You've got to conjure up a big serve from somewhere to put your opponent on the back foot.

In screams the serve, it's very wide, it kicks off the hard surface and is causing your opponent to stretch to make up the ground.
Off balance, your opponent returns a weak topspin shot right in to your path as you scream towards the net to close the angle.
You meet the return with a sweet backhand volley that heads towards the base line as your opponent scurries across to make up the ground.

The volley is a good one as the ball bounces a few inches inside the base line as your opponent tries in vain to make up the ground.
Match point saved and the pressure's off, but for how long? Have you got what it takes?

Key Features:

32 photo realistic players each with their own style and skills
16 stunningly detailed tennis stadiums in locations across the globe featuring grass, clay, hard and carpet courts
Tournament mode - team with a partner and compete against 14 of the world's greatest tennis playing countries
Multiplayer mode - fast and furious tennis with up to 4 game players in single match mode and 2 players can compete together in tournament mode
Player editor - become a character in the game and create your own dream partner
Motion captured animation provides lifelike movement and an ultra real tennis experience
Tennis consultancy provided coaches to Jennifer Capriati, Arantxa Sanchez-Vicario and Tim Henman

156494.name: Perfect Ace 2: The Championships
156494.description:
From the back of the English/European PS2 case:

“Tennis doesn’t get any better than this!” – Tim Henman

Key Features:

Licensed players, including Tim Henman.
Dozens of all new stadia.
New male and female player models and animations.
Advanced motion-blending to give total control over player movements and an ultra real tennis experience.
Full player-editor.
Full International career mode.
Fast and exciting multiplayer mode.




Game, Set & Match!

156495.name: Lady Tut
156495.description:
User Summary

Look for the buried treasure hidden within Lady Tuts' tomb. It won't be easy as many beasties inhabit the catacombs below.

156496.description:
As spring dawns the great thaw begins. Deep beneath the lush meadow grasses the queen stirs in her nest and the colony comes to life. Soldiers venture forth, battling centipedes while clashing with opposing colonies for territory. Workers dig an ever-expanding network of tunnels in their tireless search for food. The first larvae hatch and it is clear this generation will be different: the young colonies rapidly evolve into a multitude of new forms. The ants march out to claim the meadow as their own.

In March of the Ants, you create the shared Meadow board by sending your ants to explore it, revealing and strategically placing two dozen unique tiles like Fern, Pebble, and Nest of Centipedes.

Populate new territory by breeding larvae and marching your ants onto collection sites. Will you engage competing colonies in battle, seeking to claim the land for yourself? Or will you establish peaceful, symbiotic relationships and share the spoils? All of this must be done while carefully managing the resources in your underground nest.

Forage for Event Cards like Strange Appetite, Cold Snap, and Fungal Outbreak to impact the entire board – or just one unlucky opponent.

Mutate your colony with special Evolution Cards like the Trap Jaw head, Weaver thorax, and Leaf Cutter abdomen. What weird and wondrous path will your colony’s evolution take: advanced Workers, fearsome Soldiers, or a fertile Queen?

Emerge triumphant by scoring Colony Points as your ants explore and control the Meadow. Search for Colony Goals like Epic Stores, Followers of the Eyeless, and Extensive Tunnels to plan your route to victory.

March of the Ants takes strategy underground…literally!
156496.name: March of the Ants
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 20: TatterCon 2015!
Episode 65 -- A Mighty Wind (Our Gamestorm Finale)
Episode 66 part two : Totally Gaming  (somewhere)
OBG CFE 21: Bill Shakespeare is Dead
Podcast #101 - Juegos que esperamos en 2016
Podcast #104 - Juegos o juguetes
Vox Republica 141: Science Is Your Friend

156497.name: Small World: Be not Afraid!
156497.description:
User Summary

This expansion adds 5 new races and 5 new powers to your Small World games.

Races

Barbarians
Homunculi
Leprechauns
Pixies
Pygmies




Powers

Barricade
Catapult
Corrupt
Imperial
Mercenary

156498.name: Black Leaf (Issue 2 - Mar 1995)
156498.description:
The second issue explores the realm of Venden (mostly from an in-world perspective), reporting from a tourney in Wilfsburg, presenting the baronies of Dunkelhain, Carbenna, and Andor, village of Espenlaub, histories of Wilfsburg and Nordmark. It discusses the races, character classes and the gods of Venden, tells stories and rumors. Last but not least, the Ylraphon campaign from the first issue continues with part II: Der einsame Turm (The Lonely Tower).

Jack T. Chick's anti-RPG comic pamphlet Dark Dungeons is reprinted to explain the title of the periodical.

156500.name: The Hobbit: Armies of the Third Age
156500.description:
- Control the greatest Heroes of Middle-earth, including Gandalf, Legolas, and Thorin in fast-paced, tactical combat.
- Build and lead powerful armies, attacking your enemies and defending against brutal assaults.
- Choose from three races, each with unique units.
- Ally with thousands of players to wage an epic war online.

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary

The Hobbit: Armies of the Third Age is a tactical RPG/strategy game where players collect resources and build an army, then wage war against either other players or the AI opponent. Players have the option to create dwarven, elven or orcish armies.
